snippet: Throughout the crisis, chiefs at the European Union and the International Monetary Fund have been part of a policy-making triumvirate that also includes the European Central Bank.
abstract: Tensions at the heart of the European bailout troika--composed of European Union, European Central Bank and International Monetary Fund--burst into the open with unusual bout of finger-pointing over policies that have pushed parts of Europe into an economic slump more severe than the Great Depression and left the Continent as a whole far short of even Japan's anemic recovery.

byline.contributor: Jack Ewing contributed reporting from Frankfurt, and James Kanter from Brussels.

lead_paragraph: Throughout the crisis, chiefs at the European Union and the International Monetary Fund have been part of a policy-making triumvirate that also includes the European Central Bank.

headline.seo: Policy ‘Troika’ for Europe Financial Woes at Odds
headline.main: Splits Appear in Policy ‘Troika’ Addressing Europe’s Financial Crisis
